Text saved: Small animals such as birds, squirrels, mice and insects are often seen in many cities and towns. However, the news media have recently reported many more wild animals entering urban areas. For example, bears have appeared in Vancouver parks, leopards on the streets of Mumbai, and wild pigs in Berlin gardens. When larger animals move into our cities, what usually happens? People may see them as welcome guests, or they may view them as a danger or a pest.
